name: physical and sexual assault and abduction

children.name: to attack sb in a sexual way
rape b2
children.definition: rape/reɪp/  to force someone to have sex when they do not want to: hiếp dâm
examples: he was accused of raping his ex-girlfriend.
the woman was raped and then murdered by her kidnapper.
she was pulled from the car and raped.
it's difficult to understand what causes a man to rape.
rape[c or u noun] the crime of forcing sb to have sex when they do not want to: hiếp dâm, cưỡng hiếp
it was not the first time he had been accused of rape.
rape victims receive special counselling and are treated very sensitively.
a woman’s sexual history should not be introduced in a rape trial.
he was convicted of rape.
commit a rape
he had committedseveral rapes.

children.name: sexually abuse
children.definition: abuse/  to harm a child by forcing them to have sex or touching them in a sexual way, especially over a long period of time: bạo hành tình dục, lạm dụng tình dục
examples: he had been sexually abusing his daughter since she was eleven years old.
sexual abuse[u noun]
none of the children showed signs of sexual abuse.

children.name: molest x
children.definition: molest to harm or upset someone by touching them in a sexual way: lạm dụng tình dục
examples: her father had molested her and her sisters when they were children.
child-molesting[u noun]
he has not seen his child since the allegations of child-molesting were made.

children.name: sexual harassment c1
children.definition: sexual harassment when someone, especially someone you work with,regularly makes sexual remarks, looks at you in a sexual way, or tries to touch you in a sexual way that you do not want. sexual harassment can be punished by law : quấy rối tình dục
examples: victims of sexual harassment are often afraid to report it in case they lose their jobs.
she successfully prosecuted her boss for sexual harassment.

children.name: attacker x
children.definition: attacker sb who attacks another person: kẻ tấn công
examples: the attacker fled empty-handed.
your attacker(the person who attacked you)
her attacker is described as white, in his mid-fifties and with medium-length dark hair.

children.name: beater x
children.definition: beater used as a combining form to mean a person who repeatedly hits people, especially members of their family : kẻ bạo hành
examples: a child-beater/ wife-beater.

children.name: assailant x
children.definition: assailant  someone who attacks another person: kẻ tấn công
examples: unknown assailants stabbed a british tourist and wounded his wife.
mrs lundy’s alleged assailants were aquitted of all charges.

children.name: to attack sb suddenly and unexpectedly
ambush x
children.definition: ambush/ˈæmbʊʃ/  if a group of people ambush someone, they hide and wait for them and then suddenly attack them:
examples: phục kích, đánh du kích
the rebel group successfully ambushed a regiment of american reinforcements.
he was afraid he would be stopped by government troops or, even worse, ambushed by the vietcong.
parker ambushed a school bus on a field trip and held 17 children and their teacher hostage.

children.name: be set upon by x
children.definition: be set upon by/biː ˈset əpɒn baɪ/  to suddenly be attacked by people or animals, especially when you are going somewhere- used especially in written or literary contexts:
examples: bị tấn công đột ngột ( văn chương )
he had been set upon by bat-wielding racists, so he understood how i felt.
the drivers were set upon by a mob, including several women, which showered them with stones.

children.name: turn on x
children.definition: turn on/ turn upon/ˈtɜːʳn ɒn, ˈtɜːʳn əpɒn/  to suddenly attack someone you are with, especially when it is very unexpected: đột nhiên tấn công (ai đang ở gần bạn)
examples: red with rage, frank turned on anna, grasping her arm in a vice-like grip.
then the warriors turned upon each other, for a fight to the death.

children.name: strike b1
children.definition: strike/straɪk/  to make aquicksuddenattack especially on someone who is not expecting to be attacked:
examples: tấn công ( đột ngột )
▪ they felt sure the killer would strike again, but could not say when.
họ chắn chắn kẻ giết người sẽ quay lại tấn công, nhưng không thể biết là khi nào
▪ the police struck at dawn in a carefully timed operation to catch the bombers.
cảnh sát tấn công vào lúc bình minh trong một cuộc hành quân đã được huẩn bị cẩn thận để bắt những kẻ đánh bom

children.name: pounce x
children.definition: pounce/paʊns/  to suddenly jump on another person from a place where you have been hiding, in order to catch or attack them:bất thình lình tấn công ( ẩn trong 1 nơi rồi đột nhiên nhảy ra tấn công )
examples: be ready/waiting/set to pounce
▪ he crouched on the ground, like an animal ready to pounce.pounce on
anh ta cúi xuống đất , giống như một con vật đã sẵn sàng để tấn công thình lình
▪ before he could rescue it, the cat pounced on the bird and carried it to the bushes.
trước khi có thể giải cứu nó , con mèo nhảy lên một cách thình lình vào con chim và mang nó đến những bụi rậm

children.name: jump x
children.definition: jump/dʒʌmp/   to attack someone suddenly and usually from behind, in order to injure them or to rob them: nhảy bổ tấn công ( từ phía sau )
examples: two guys tried to jump me in the park last night
he climbed over the wall and jumped the guard, easily overpowering him.

children.name: sb who attacks sb else in a sexual way
rapist x
children.definition: rapist kẻ hiếp dâm
examples: rapists and child sex offenders are kept separate from other prisoners.

children.name: molester x
children.definition: molester a person who sexually assaults or abuses someone, especially a woman or child :người gạ gẫm
examples: a serial child molester
child molester
achildmolester

children.name: sex offender x
children.definition: sex offender a person who commits a crime involving a sexual attack
examples: some parents are demanding access to the sex offenders'register(= a list, kept by the police, of all the people who have been found guilty in a court of a sexual offence) .

children.name: domestic violence x
children.definition: domestic violence when sb you live with attacks you and tries to hurt you : nạn bạo hành trong gia đình
examples: victims of domestic violence
domestic violence against women
police, social services, and voluntary agencies are working together to tackle domestic violence.

children.name: attack b1
children.definition: attack when sb uses violence against another person and tries to hurt them: vụ tấn công
examples: the attack took place as she was walking home.
attack on
they finally caught the gang responsible for the armed attacks on foreigners in dakar.
new statistics show a further increase in attacks on women.
racial/ sexual/ physical attack
fong did not suffer a physical attack, but he was humiliated by the three men.
victims of racial attacks njan nhân của vụ tấn công chủng tộc
there was no indication of a sexual attack.
vicious/ nasty/ unprovoked etc attack
police say it was a particularly nasty attack.
a number of brutal and unprovoked attacks on gays

children.name: assault c2
children.definition: assault an attack on someone - use this especially when talking about the crime of attacking sb: cuộc tấn công, hành hung
examples: the charges against the prisoner include criminal damage and assault.
assault on
assaults on public transportation workers have doubled in the last 10 years.
theylaunchedan assaultonthe capital yesterday.
indecent/ sexual/ violent assault
he was convicted of adultery and indecent assault.
the problem of domestic violence and sexual assault within the home
aggravated assault[u noun] [legal] a serious, violent attack on someone : hành hung tàn bạo

children.name: stabbing x
children.definition: stabbing a crime in which someone is stabbed : vụ đâm người
examples: a fatal stabbing
there have been several stabbings in our neighbourhood recently.

children.name: attack b1
children.definition: attack/əˈtæk/  to use violence against someone and try to hurt them: tấn công
examples: a woman was attacked by three youths while she was out jogging in central park.
police dogs are trained to attack in certain circumstances.
he was badly injured when one of his own bulls attacked him.
attack sb with with
her husband attacked her with a knife. chồng cô tấn công cô bằng dao

children.name: assault c2
children.definition: assault/əˈsɔːlt/  to attack and hurt someone - use this especially to talk about the crime of attacking someone : hành hung
examples: he assaulted a female flight attendant who refused to serve him more drinks.
some supporters ran onto the field and assaulted the referee.
sexually assault sb: cưỡng hiếp ai đó
she was kidnapped and sexually assaulted at gunpoint.

children.name: stab b2
children.definition: stab/stæb/  to attack sb by pushing a knife into them: đâm
examples: the victim had been stabbed six times.
stab sb in sth
meyers was stabbed once in the abdomen and once in the neck.
stab at
her assailant lunged, stabbing at her again and again.

children.name: go for x
children.definition: go for to attack sb with a sudden violent movement: tấn công (đột ngột )
examples: go for somebody
charlie went for murray as soon as he entered the room, pushing him up against the wall.
go for somebody with something : tấn công ai với cái gì
one day grandma got so mad she went for grandpa with the kitchen knife.
go for somebody’s throat/ears/eyes etc :
the dog went straight for my throat, without warning.
if you are attacked, go for your attacker’s eyes as they are the most vulnerable part of the face.

children.name: lay into x
children.definition: lay into/ˈleɪ ɪntuː/  to attack someone very violently, hitting them repeatedly and without control:đánh túi bụi
examples: lay into sb : đánh ai túi bụi
from the moment the bell rang, tyson laid into his opponent.
ngay khi tiếng chuông reo, tyson đánh túi bụi vào mặt đối thủ
lay into sb with sth
the video shows a policeman repeatedly laying into a protestor with his baton.

children.name: to take sb away using force
take away u
children.definition: take away/ˌteɪk əˈweɪ/  if soldiers, the police etc take someone away, they force that person to go with them : dẫn khỏi, đem khỏi
examples: take sb away
the soldiers took my son away and i never saw him again.
luis told me how he’d been picked up by military police in the middle of the night, and taken away for questioning.
take away sb
at that time police would often take away suspected revolutionaries and throw them in jail with a trial.

children.name: abduct x
children.definition: abduct to take sb away by force, especially a child or young person, often in order to kill them or sexually attack them - used especially in news reports:bắt cóc/dẫn ai đi
examples: the two high school girls were abducted at gunpoint on tuesday.
kurdish separatists have abducted a japanese tourist and are demanding money for his safe return.
abduct sb from sth
several young women had been abducted from their villages and forced to work as prostitutes.
abduction[u noun]
the man is charged with the abduction and rape of a 12-year-old schoolgirl.

children.name: kidnap x
children.definition: kidnap/ˈkɪdnæp/  to take sb away by force and keep them as your prisoner, in order to make their family or their government give you money or other things you want: bắt cóc
examples: terrorists have kidnapped a french officer and are demanding $400,000 from the french government.
he was kidnapped by vigilantes in el centro, beaten and robbed, and then set on fire.
kidnapping[c or u noun] when someone is kidnapped: sự bắt cóc
most diplomats now travel with bodyguards, following a series of kidnappings.
he has been charged with the kidnapping of his ex-girlfriend.
victims of kidnapping: nạn nhân bắt cóc

children.name: take sb hostage c2
children.definition: take sb hostage to take someone and keep them as a prisoner, especially for political reasons, and threaten to kill them if their government does not do what you demand: bắt làm con tin
examples: on january 6, six italian nuns were taken hostage.
guerrilla fighters seized the hospital yesterday, taking patients and staff hostage, although several dozen were later released.

children.name: indecent exposure x
children.definition: indecent exposure  tội ở truồng nơi công cộng, tội công xúc tu sỉ
examples: the criminal offence of deliberately showing your sex organs in a place where this is likely to offend people
